Pre-Game Insights: Andrew Jett is going to stick with the Mets.
Severino had a decent start in his first postseason appearance this year, notching 6.0 innings with three earned on eight hits and two walks.
Prior to that however, Severino was just okay with 10 earned over a span of 16.0 innings heading into the playoffs.
He’ll need a quality outing here to get New York started on the right foot.
Five different pitchers got work in Game 1, so it’d be nice to see Severino get a lengthy outing Sunday.
Brandon Nimmo had two of the team’s six RBI, and the pitching staff did the rest.
